page.title: 12LUCAS STORES, BOLNEY
page.content: It is a small{supermarket. } We saw a piece of window_frame signed {Henry Tulley 1872.}The Tulleys owned it and sold clothes & ironmongery. { Frederick Lucas}bought the shop in {1924}and made it into a grocery store. His son{Cyril,}who now owns the shop, became a{partner in 1950.}Frederick,at 83,still comes in to weigh_up the potatoes. They are open from{9a.m.to 5p.m.}and close for an hour at lunch times,Sat. afternoons & all every day Sunday. Cyril is usually in the shop from 7a.m. to take in early deliveries. He has{5 staff,}who all work part time.They are{4 ladies and 1 man. Mr.Lucas does make deliveries but not outside of Bolney. The shop's cat of 17 yrs. does a good job of keeping the mice away. { On the next page is a shopping list.
